page.title: 09CHANGE IN THE KEIGHLEY AREA
page.content: The old mill at {Goose Eye }was originally part of{Keighley's}textile industry.However falling demand forced its closure.Unlike other mills it was not demolished or left to stand idle, instead it now serves a different purpose.Part of it has been turned into a nightclub and disco whilst in another part {Goose Eye Ales}are brewed.This shows the change from old style manufacturing industry to growth industries like leisure. At{Oakworth}the{Keighley and Worth {Valley Railway}has a station. This is a working railway of about 5 miles length.Although this feature has not changed its use it now carries mainly tourists and visitors to {Haworth. Again what was formerly of use to the manufacturing industry of the area has been adapted to serve the needs of the leisure industry.
